metadata.title: CVE-2019-2974 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.45 andprior, 5.7.27 and prior and 8.0.17 and prior. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang orfrequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2974` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
mariadb-10.1 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.43-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
